website_summaries.verdict: The New Balance 608 v5 received high praises for combining style and comfort. Many commenters also raved about its fit and the availability of multiple width options. The shoe also seemed to excel in terms of durability and underfoot support. Overall, the trainer came highly recommended because it was a comfortable training and walking companion.
pros: The comfort offered by New Balance 608 v5 was much lauded by a majority of consumers
The trainer was marked true to size and width, as many users enjoyed its overall fit
A myriad of wearers liked the style of the footwear because it looked similar to a dress shoe, especially the black variant
Numerous testers were impressed with the product’s durability
Many purchasers marveled at how supported their arches felt while wearing this model
Multiple folks commended the traction on this merchandise
Several shoppers appreciated that the footgear accommodated the use of custom orthotics
The lightweight nature of the shoe resonated well with some individuals
cons: The insert was not as comfortable as several buyers had hoped, so they had to replace it or wait for it to break in
The faux leather disappointed a few critics who thought the material made the shoe look cheap and not durable
A handful of reviewers wished that the collar was higher to provide more ankle support

customer_reviews.title: Narrow toe box
customer_reviews.text: As shown in the picture, the toe box on the 608v5 (left) is much, much narrower than it was on the 608v3 (right). I bought these to replace my old 608v3 shoes, and I bought the same size and width. While the old 608v3 shoes fit my feet perfectly, the new 608v5 shoes are much too narrow up front, causing my big toe to jam into the side of the shoe. The rest of the shoe feels the same in terms of length and in terms of width along the rest of the shoe. I don't know why New Balance would make such a dramatic change in the fit (or last) but keep the same model number. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Fit. Will Never Buy Again.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the 608 V4 for years. Love them. I hate the Version 5. I've tried to break this pair in; but, I've given up. When I compare the Version 4 to the Version 5, I can see a slight difference in how they shoes fit around the ankle. As a result, it presses against the bottom of my ankle and causes my little toe to go spastic. A mile into my walk, my ankle and little toe are numb on my right foot.
customer_reviews.author: HJSV

customer_reviews.title: super comfortable and nice looking shoes
customer_reviews.text: My old pair of New Balance 608V2 shoes were pretty worn out so I started looking at the newer versions and came across these 608v5 models. Super comfortable - feel like they're broken in right out of the box. Lighter than the older ones as well. These are my church and dress up shoes as well as just good old everyday shoes if needed. Worth every $
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch the wobble on NB 608v5 shoes thru this site!
customer_reviews.text: Mine were very uneven when placed oin a flat surface - this is what I've been told to do by shoe buyers! If they wobble front to back/side-side - they are not good to wear. These were definitely not good to wear. Plus, the order page only gave "WIDE" as a choice, and they cam e to me as 2E, when I needed 4E.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hill

customer_reviews.title: Well cushioned
customer_reviews.text: Compared to version 4, it feels better cushioned and the toe box is bigger in my D width. Some may not like the fake leather, but I think it looks nice and will clean with a damp sponge which makes them the perfect winter walking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Faulty shoe, will disintegrate.
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for about 2 weeks and noticed that the sole was peeling at the edge. Within 4 weeks of wearing 3-4 days a week the entire sole on one speaker had completely separated and the other sole was halfway peeled off. The shoes also started separating at the seams. Not sure if it was an isolated defect, counterfeit product, or just a faulty model but I will not buy again. New Balance should last for at least 4 months if not longer.
customer_reviews.author: cyberlance

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes if you have flat feet
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have very little arch support. They're almost flat. There's no way that I can wear theses shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Flux Capacitor

customer_reviews.title: Mis labeled or just the wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this specific model shoe in the past and the 7.5 D fit fine. But the last pair I ordered was not the size it claimed to be. I could not wear them because they were 1/2 shorter than the old pair I have which is labeled as the same size.
customer_reviews.author: VCS

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, not comfortable at all
customer_reviews.text: Nothing remotely close to the previous version V4, which is very disappointing. The foam inside bottom of the shoe is made from cheap material (not memory foam).
customer_reviews.author: DJ_King_SD

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit, questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two pairs of New Balance MW411v2 12EE that fit perfectly. These New Balance 608v5 12EE shoes are too wide so the foot flops around in the shoe. They also look like they are not made for a foot and have much less under sole cushioning than the MW411v2. Returns to this vendor because the shoe does not fit properly cost $6.00.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope

customer_reviews.title: wide feet shoes
customer_reviews.text: this version of the 608 is the best one so far. more comfortable and supportive than the v4. don't know how long it will last due to the fake leather but will let you know. the fit is better for me due to the mx-001 last this shoe is made on. it gives you more room in the instep area that i need. if you have wide feet and a high instep order this shoe. you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: brian shannon

customer_reviews.title: Size 14 wide is actually about a size 13 wide.
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear size 14 wide shoes. I ordered New Balance 608V5 size 14 wide shoes. They were more like a size 13 wide shoe. I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: didn't fit correctly
customer_reviews.text: We had our Insurance Companies yearly dinner. So I trying on this new pair. They didn't fit right, but said to myself, just hang-in they will adjust to your foot. Wrong, I felt like I was trying to walk pidgin toed with the lift on the outer side of hill twisting my foot.
customer_reviews.author: the Dunn Company of Texas

customer_reviews.title: I used to love NB!
customer_reviews.text: New Balance shoes have went from being a great value to an inconsistent product that I may never buy again. It seems that the American made shoes were great but the offshore models just don't have the same quality. I now have 4 pair that I just won't or can't wear because they are just flat out uncomfortable! I have tried different styles and have found that only 1 pair out of the last 5 I have bought gave me satisfactory performance. My last walking shoe I purchased was from Brookes. I am pretty happy with these so far!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Jolly

customer_reviews.title: New Balance keeps moving away from comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have V4 of these in white and the toe box is wide and comfortable. I bought these hoping for the same. I was very disappointed when they arrived. New Balance has narrowed the toe box on these as they seem to be doing with all of their latest versions. It seems that they are moving away from the customer base that helped to build the brand. I have worn New Balance for over 25 years and they have always been my go to shoes for casual and walking/running shoes. I guess with the new designs they will be losing another customer.
customer_reviews.author: SV219

customer_reviews.title: The shoes were fine, but the first order of shoes were too small.
customer_reviews.text: Greetings ... Reviewer, I returned the size 15 shoes as it was too small. My toes were touching the tip of the shoe, making it uncomfortable to wear for any length of time. On a positive note, the company made good on refunding my CC charged to it, when I returned the shoes. The quality of the shoes were good. Considering the various sizes from different companies and nations, it was expected the first ordered shoes would be either too big or in this case too small. Thank you N ...
customer_reviews.author: Fred MacRae

customer_reviews.title: function over fashion
customer_reviews.text: I like the 608 NB, I have a wide foot and they seem to fit the best of the NB line of shoes. I like the cushion too, I'm on my feet a lot and they keep my feet and knees from hurting. My kid says they are old peoples shoes, but this old guy goes for comfort over style, and these shoes are it. They do seem to wear out faster than I would like but for the price I buy 2 sets at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen McDuffee

customer_reviews.title: they last a hard year.
customer_reviews.text: So i bought these april 14 2019. Gone through alot walks through midway airport. Through AZ mountains, grand canyon, the trails in the UP of Michigan. Hills in California. Multiple leather tratments and waterproofing. Waterproofing is useless. They clean up ok. Comfort is nice. I used Dr. Scholls inserts most of the shoes life. But the bottom insert is coming up sometimes and the grip is worn now. I call them my dad shoes. Gonna the same thing again
customer_reviews.author: PyroParrish

customer_reviews.title: V5 means they were made cheaper and cheaper 5x.
customer_reviews.text: They use to advertise made in the USA. These are from Vietnam. They’re 4E’s but not as wide as my other 3 pairs of NB 4E’s. The insides aren’t as padded and the material in there is no longer sewed down. The heal cap is no longer solid. You can press where the suede meets the rubber and see how fragile they are. Everything about them feels more fragile then my old one’s. I’m positive they won’t last very long which Is probably the plan. On the other hand they cost more. I think they have profit optimized themselves out of another long time customer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Toe box is too small
customer_reviews.text: Showed up on time, I use inserts so I removed the ones that came with the shoe and put mine in. The inserts were a little tight but, not bad. Put on the shoes and the first thing I noticed was the arch wasn't quit right, my foot was pushed back too far. So I re-laced and it helped some. I wore them around the house for about four hours but, in the end my toes were just too tight. Ended up returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Y

customer_reviews.title: The worst version ever
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing New Balance (this model), for 20 years. This is the worst version yet. You can feel the cheapness when you pick it up and hold it. Lighter in weight than previously. I double, triple, and quadruple checked to make sure I got the right size, and it turns out, the shoe is slightly too big. Further, I was not allowed to contact the seller to return item, nor was I able to leave a review. Now, they're asking me for my opinion. Here it is: your product sucks. You cheaped out on quality but kept the same price. Congratulations, you suck. I will never recommend NB to anyone ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Gunzon

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOES FOR THE MONEY !!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd pair of these I have bought over the past 5 years. They fit and feel great and actually hold up well. I do add Dr. Scholls pads to them for more comfort as I use them to play tennis in about 3-4 times a week and play 11 months out of the year on hard and soft courts... I still have the first pair and still use them when working outside. For the money, I don't think you can beat them
customer_reviews.author: goodoneleftTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Beware of 608V5 changes
customer_reviews.text: Have used New Balance 608 shoes for men in V2, V3 and they were fine. These are V5 and New Balance has made the toe box into a very tapered shape. Very uncomfortable as it rubs on the side of my big toe. Also the sole has been changed to a one piece sole and seems to rock when you are standing on it. I am returning and have found a pair of V4 which still have the original toe box shape. Very poor design by New Balance. Very disappointing. Hopefully New Balance will change the toe box design on the nest version.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Get a half size larger.
customer_reviews.text: I have had New Balance Shoes for the past 8 years. You can't go wrong with them. I have diabetic neuropathy and use orthotics. I use to go though other shoes every 3 to 6 months. I found New Balance Shoes are a great value. I only use one pair of shoes at a time and they last 2 years. They are my go to shoe. Will be buying another pair soon.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Well-built and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Just got these shoes a day ago, tried them on and walked 5 miles or so in them. No break-in required! Fit is perfect and comfortable for me. These shoes appear to be better quality construction than the Nike Air Monarchs and Skecher shoes I have been wearing for the past years. Gave up on the Monarchs, after 4 pairs or so I got tired of the squeak that all of them seemed to have. Skechers were all comfortable, but the comfort insoles would wear through in a matter of weeks, requiring Dr. Scholls insoles. Wear on the Skechers was rapid. Hoping these New Balance shoes will hold up over a 1000 mi. or so of walking!
customer_reviews.author: Clark Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Not the V4 shoe at all. Really stupid with the width naming change.
customer_reviews.text: V4 was a great shoe comfy, walking on air. These are harder thinner flatter soles. They seem clumsy to walk in. Bought 624 and 928 -all virtually identical -all not comfortable. Width chart is wrong. I buy NB shoes because they came in 4E. Chart aligns with Wide for 4E -I didn't believe it -said X Wide was 6E. Should have gone with my gut. Old 4E is X Wide. Putting up with them, should have returned them, still wearing the old falling apart V4s and wondering why I can't get more
customer_reviews.author: Keith P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoe at Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the New Balance to replace worn out Nike shoes for my daily walk. Comfortable cushion in the heel area, but less so under ball of the foot. I got the extra wide, but I think I may be between sizes because the more narrow shoe, that I had previously purchased, seemed too tight. Consequently, I only gave 4 stars for Support and Comfort compared to my old Nikes. The best thing is that the New Balance shoe doesn't squeak like the old Nikes that is rather annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Zia Fan

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered sneakers and shoes on line in the past and have not found it to be the best way to order, not having the ability to try on before purchasing. These New Balance sneakers are excellent, in how they look and fit. From the first time on I had zero problems, I walked a few miles in them and it felt like I didn't have anything on my feet, my feet were not tired. Great sneaker, will have to order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This 608 v5 is even better than v4.....seems to have a better insole. I've worn these for a long time for working in the yard. I mow a 1/2 acre yard with a walk-behind mower and these are my go to shoes. They are comfortable and very stable. I also use a Dr. Scholl's insert because I have size 14, flat feet with a very misshapen fifth metatarsal. I recommend them because they are a great value for about 50 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Carnival

customer_reviews.title: The soles suck
customer_reviews.text: I've had two pairs of the 608 v4 and I think two pairs of the v3 and many other New balance shoes for home and work. In the two months I've had these shoes they are wearing too fast. The softer rubber of the "no slip soles" is wearing too fast and there is a gap in the rubber soles right where the ball of you foot goes. Why you would put useless foam right where you push off of your foot when you are walking I'm not sure. the rest of the shoe fits fine. I will not be buying this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Batt

customer_reviews.title: New model 608v5 is not the same as prior reliable 608v4
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many New Balance 608v4, 11.5 4e, fit and comfort was always as expected for years. I find that the new 608v5 is a downturn in comfort, shoes are much harder and stiffer. The 4e width also is more narrow in the new model. Sad, I have bought a dozen prior 608's, but downturn in comfort will force me to look for new models or brands. I see Amazon sells Brooks in width sizes, moving over on next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BigD

customer_reviews.title: Best fit I've had in a long, long, time.  Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Fit: At the "thrifty" shoe outlets or at better ones in department stores, most of the times I have to fudge on my size in order to get comfort and support. Not this pair! It made it exactly to my size as measured in inches and applied to the size chart. I've had the pair about a month. After supper, though, I enjoy taking it off and letting my feet "breathe". Support: Puts a spring in my step. Surrounds my foot with comfort and sureness over regular and uneven surfaces. My spouse has asked me to get another pair for myself in a different color - - she likes 'em too.
customer_reviews.author: Taco Monster

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and ripped after 1 & 1/2 week
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because they were leather and thought they would last longer. This is after one and one half weeks of wear. The top of the toe appears to be man made pleather.... as you can see cheap and ripped in no time at all
customer_reviews.author: Skymom

customer_reviews.title: great sneaker!
customer_reviews.text: I don't wear sneaks often, mostly I wear boots, but 9 years ago I got a pair of new balance and they were great, light weight, quality leather good bottom and durable. Welp I wore out the bottoms 9 years later, so I went looking for a new pair of the same kind. I was tol this model is the equal to what I had and it basically is, feels exactly the same as the old pair. been wearing them everyday for a week to break them in, honestly they were broken in in one day. Very very happy and glad to see the wuality hasnt changed one bit and the price only went up 15$ from 9 years ago..
customer_reviews.author: TVByDemand

customer_reviews.title: New Balance Men's 608 V5 Casual Comfort Cross Trainer
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers fit me well and are comfortable. My only complaint so far is that the little loop in the tongue to keep it in place is high up on the tongue and gets in the way of tightening and loosening the laces when putting them on and taking them off. Using the top holes for the laces is not comfortable for me. Last year, I had trouble finding sneakers in a wide width at a reasonable price, so I was happy to find these. I've been walking between 3 and 4 miles a day in them. Haven't had a chance to do much else in them because of the pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: pl

customer_reviews.title: ripped after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I think these are nockoffs. Ive bought 608's for years and they all last me about 2-3 years. I know exactly how they degrade and where. This pair started ripping in the leather toe section 2 months after i bought them. This is not normal. I will not buy these online ever again, but where i normally get them from now on. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: metulburr

customer_reviews.title: One of the better New Balance brand sneakers.
customer_reviews.text: I love these sneakers. I have owned about 3 or 4 them and have always been satisfied with them. I think these have better support than other New balance makes and feel great when walking long distances and going up hills. Also I wore a pair of these when I was walking around Athens Greece during one of my trips their and they felt great during my many walks around the center of Athens. No pain or discomfort at he end of the day. So overall I would highly recommend these shoes over the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore

customer_reviews.title: I’ve been missing out
customer_reviews.text: Came home from work after 12 hours on concrete to find my package had arrived. Sliced open the packaging, slipped these shoes on and laced them up. IMMEDIATE difference! With my feet hurting from work and plantar fasciitis I didn’t expect to feel relief so quickly and they’re so lightweight it’s almost as if I’m not even wearing shoes. I chose the gray 608s in 10.5 wide and I’d already suggest them to my friends and family. First pair of NB shoes I’ve ever owned and assuming the durability holds up, this could be the beginning of a good relationship.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: The fit
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these before. They are comfortable , fit right , but they only last a year. So while they are still available I will continue to purchase them. They are a great sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph G

customer_reviews.title: Can the shoes REALLY make a difference?
customer_reviews.text: Started walking at least 32 minutes a day after recovering from a mini-stroke. At first, I wore my work shoes and clocked in about 1.8 to 1.9 miles according to a GPS sports tracking app. After I bought these, my distance jumped to at least 2 miles. From Day One, the shoes fit like they were broken in. They’re more cushiony than the work shoes with a thicker heel that induces a toes-down step. Perhaps all of that results in a cadence and stride that eats up the concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ekaitis: The Gray Haired Geek

customer_reviews.title: Normally need 5E, but wide (2E) was big enough for me
customer_reviews.text: If you need wide shoes, these are it. Got another pair of NB shoes (510 V5) sized extra wide (4E), and those were too narrow for my feet. I could get them on, but they were tight. Not these. Reasonably comfortable, and probably ok for some light cardio, but I definitely wouldn't run a marathon in them or anything. Good walking shoe though, as they have proper support.
customer_reviews.author: Benny Hana

customer_reviews.title: New Balance 608 V5s continue a successful line of cross trainers
customer_reviews.text: Having just put my new 608 V5 cross trainers through the 1-hour rigours of my yoga class, I left feeling that the purchase was beyond my expectations. New Balance Men's 608 V5 Casual Comfort Cross Trainers are just as good for walking around the house and with equal comfort. A minor drawback (mentioned by another purchaser) is the slightly narrowing at the toe space. So, I simply went to a wider fit as listed in the provided sizing chart. As a longtime owner of other sneakers in the 608 line, I am a very satisfied customer again.
customer_reviews.author: musicman

customer_reviews.title: Good Work Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I use these for work and they are a good shoe for me. I have a very wide foot and I find New Balance to be some of the only ones to to fit ke well. I am on my feet all day at work constantly walking. The non slip bottom is nice and gives good grip. The only real downside is the sole starts to flatten out pretty quickly which means the shoes only last me about 6 months before getting new ones. However, walking near 6 miles a day at work and they still last that long is pretty nice. Overall good shoe for those with wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Cody G.

customer_reviews.title: These don't fit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace some worn out New Balance 619's that nobody seems to have now. They look pretty similar but after wearing the for a couple of hours both of my small toes began to hurt. I did some research and found that several people had complained about the same problem. As it turns out, a NB rep told one person that they had made the "toe box" narrower for unknown reasons. So that's why they are uncomfortable. I would caution anyone thinking of purchasing these. I returned them and got a pair of Nike's.
customer_reviews.author: Butter

customer_reviews.title: The heal is too cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Although I love the fit of the shoe and I was hoping for them to have fixed this problem with the new model, they have actual made it worse. The price is right for a pair of 13eeee that fit but the lack of foam at the heal means these are 2-3 month shoes MAX! Do not buy these for activities such as walking or playing sports its not worth the blisters. NB please put an extra three dollars back into the heal so these shoes just dont end up looking great in the dumpster a short while later.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Griswold

customer_reviews.title: Initial Reaction - Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I read that this shoe was rated very highly as a walking shoe. I have worn them three times so far on my morning 30 minute walk and my left foot goes numb. Did not happen with the shoes I previously wore so I am left to believe that these shoes do not provide the support or cushioning I need. Am going to continue wearing them on shorter walks in hopes they will feel better. I am 5 feet 9 inches tall and weigh 178 pounds; I walk at a pace of 3.5 miles per hour for 30 minutes daily.
customer_reviews.author: DJG

customer_reviews.title: The perfect shoe for me (11 1/2 4E xwide)
customer_reviews.text: I have an active job where I average daily about 5 miles a day, 2 flights of stairs and climb in and out of the back of a pick up truck constantly. My feet and ankles would kill me after work. I have a wide boney foot and always had trouble finding shoes that could accommodate my size. I bought my first pair over six months ago. I no longer think about my feet which is great. I don't have to add insoles for support. I appreciate these shoes so much that I bought two more pairs incase they stop making them.
customer_reviews.author: Ramesh B.

customer_reviews.title: New Balance Cross Trainer for Men
customer_reviews.text: I purchase New Balance in LEATHER UPPERS, for my husband, who is 68, has diabetes, COPD and heart disease. He isn't extremely active, but wears his shoes every day. He is on his feet often, cooking or taking care of me (I am bedridden from a stroke, paralyzed.) These shoes have good support. He prefers the tie version of New Balance, although there is a velcro loop/hook style. I recommend New Balance Cross Trainers for anyone, especially people who need good support shoes. I find the Cross Trainer to have better features than the Walkers, but that might be preference.
customer_reviews.author: Analisa March

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but is narrower than any other New Balance models I have purchased.
customer_reviews.text: All the previous New Balance shoes I purchased were 14 regular, which fit me just fine. So, I ordered the same size when I decided to try the model 608. As soon as I took them out of the box, they looked narrower, with a more pointed toe! Definitely too snug on the outside of my small toes. I had to return them and get the 14 W, and I have never in my life ever purchased a wide shoe...always regular. You would think an athletic shoe of the same brand would be more consistent in their sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mills

customer_reviews.title: Soles came off after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable once broke in. They run true to size & are plenty wide. ( 10.5 4E/X-Wide) The leather uppers are well made, but the bottom layer of the soles started coming off after 8 months. I spend most of my time driving so they don't have a lot of 'miles" on the soles. I give the shoe 5 stars, but the sole only gets 2 stars. I will buy again, but only because they are the only shoes that I can get in all black leather that actually fit my feet without going to boots.
customer_reviews.author: Speargun

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Comfort
customer_reviews.text: My husband had an accident some years back, he broke his heel. Since then, he has had to live with pain daily, while wearing shoes. A friend told him about these shoes, as he has almost the identical heel issues. OMG, for the first time in years, he is able to wear shoes more than a couple of hours. Once he takes them off, he is no long limping, like he did with other shoes! I am getting ready to order him another pair. Imagine how comfortable these shoes must be if you are not dealing with daily foot pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classic look, poor support
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for the NB classic look and because of the high ratings. It is well made with good fit and finish. While it boasts of having a "soft and supportive comfort insert", the insole is absolutely flat with no heal cup and no arch support. It appears to be made of some gel- like material, it is very thin - almost worthless. I bought an after-market supportive insole which really helped. Also, the shoe laces are way too long -- need to tuck them in the shoe. Next time I will look for other models.
customer_reviews.author: P. Steelquist

customer_reviews.title: Broke after only 2 months
customer_reviews.text: My right leg is my dominant leg, and the right show after 2 months started causing a painful blister at the heel. I discovered that the padding had disappeared there. This has never happened with any other shoe in my lifetime; usually wear-and-tear is at the sole, never at the heel. I cut out a piece of plastic at the heel area and got another week of use out of it, until a top part started fraying. One star, despite it being very comfortable and stylish before it became painful.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Holden

customer_reviews.title: 😁 ( my feet are happy ) 😁
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes , thats saying something because generally don't buy shoes. Because it so hard to find shoes that are comfortable that fit properly . I generally buy Redwing boots , but at around $300.00 a pair that can get expensive. I was so happy to find these shoes they come in 4E sizes ( awesome ) ! I love my boots but sometimes I like something a little more comfortable a not as heavy. So these shoes are the answer for me , could be for you as well . $ ( not a bad price point either ) $
customer_reviews.author: Heinrich

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe; exactly as described & what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this shoe for my grown son; size 10 1/2 EE; they fit perfectly, he appreciates how comfortable they are. Reviews are correct in saying they are great for every day wear; well-constructed, extremely comfortable, and look good to wear anywhere. Son is diabetic; hence he is careful when purchasing shoes, but these fit great; thus he can wear them all day for working out, hiking, on the job - - wears w/shorts or long pants, and states that his feet never get tired or sweaty. This was a smart purchase, and I am thrilled that Amazon has them in stock. This is a really good looking shoe, and I would not hesitate to purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Belle

customer_reviews.title: Poor sole design
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing New Balance 608 for 15 years with an aggressive sole design. This smooth sole configuration is a Problem for me. I bought a pair of red New Balance sneaker with same smooth design. I had a near catastrophic event almost going over the railing at the Ballpark due to the smooth sole configuration. I want to exchange these sneakers for New Balance 608 that have the traditional sole
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Typical New Balance
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of many people who seem to believe that New Balance makes the only shoes who fit them right, likely because they produce shoes in wider sizes than most. I've been wearing New Balance sneakers almost exclusively for 10 - 15 years and they have seen their ups and downs in quality. My Suede 608v5s seem very well made and are very comfortable for daily wear. I expect these to be my go-to shoes every day until it's time to replace them, and I suspect like all the other NB 608's I've had over the years it will be hard to tell when it's time to replace them because they will wear so well with time.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Pesci

customer_reviews.title: Love the New Balance 608s
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a previous version of the same shoe I've worn for a few years. Couldn't find the brown suede version of these shoes locally so I got them here. Perfect fit. The piping around the N logo on the side is now too bright for me but I toned it down with some permanent black marker. Otherwise, very good value & for my wide feet these are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Humbo

customer_reviews.title: Hubby likes them so much he is ordering another one.
customer_reviews.text: My hubby had ordered this previously for work. He used it until his big toe went through the sole. 🤣. He likes them so much he is ordering another one. These shoes provides him with comfort and arch support, which is important to him.
customer_reviews.author: SSKamaka

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size.
customer_reviews.text: I had these shoes shipped to where I was staying on vacation. The price was great, but I got a little concerned when I saw reviews saying they received the wrong size in the box labeled for the correct size. Sure enough, the shoes that came out of the box labeled 16 D (which is what I ordered) were 17 D! Fortunately, though a little large, they work for my purpose and I’ll keep them. If I’d been home I would send them back. Decent shoe, bad packaging. Four stars for one day early shipping and incredible price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing New Balance for many years following a diagnosis of plantar fascistic. I love them! When my husband mentioned he needed a new pair of good training shoes, I knew I had to order these for him. I'm sure he will become a loyal customer for his future needs.
customer_reviews.author: M. HULDERMAN

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for a friend who is a new dad
customer_reviews.text: At first my friend had no idea he was getting the official Dad gift, but he worked hard for it. These shoes showed up at his front door, and he knew he was finally in the Dad Club. He said he would never wear them, but when he slipped them on, he had never felt such comfort. He now mows the lawn, walks the baby, and goes to Home Depot exclusively in these shoes. Make sure you are a dad first! These shoes are not for those who are not a parent yet!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Aichele

customer_reviews.title: Sneaker size incorrect
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift Nike sneakers. I ordered a size 10 D that my spouse has worn for the last 50 years including other Nike sneakers. Could not wear with or without socks to small.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dunson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I need a 4E in shoes due to foot issues. Some manufacturers say 4E but it is still too tight on my forefoot. These shoes are absolutely the widest shoes I have ever had. They do not hurt my feet in any way. They are well made and well padded. I still use my orthotics with them so have great padding underneath. If you have extra wide feet or have foot issues these are the shoes for you.
customer_reviews.author: Shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: The New Balance Brand has stayed consistent over the years.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has worn this shoe for many years. We were excited to find them on Amazon since our stores were closed during Shelter-in-Place. He was a little hesitant because he could not try them on before purchasing but went ahead with the purchase because Amazon is so easy to work with on returns. They are the perfect fit - exactly what he could have bought in the store. He hates shopping in stores so much, I see many more of these purchases in his future.
customer_reviews.author: KSC

customer_reviews.title: New gym shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: At 66 years old I don't tear up the gym like I used to but it's still important to support my tired old feet to get the best workout. I'm very familiar with New Balance over the years and know my hard to fit size making me confident to get a good fit and these shoes didn't disappoint. The trendy style looks good with my newly slender body which only adds to my confidence. If I am still working out when these shoes wear out I will replace them with the same ones.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Douglass

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are my 2nd pair of these and they are comfortable from day one. They offer a good level of support for a suede trainer / walking shoe. They are over all good quality with a decent insole. While the insoles do fail before the overall shoe, they are of quality memory foam unlike the compressed fiber insoles provided with most options at this price point. These also look more stylish in suede then the standard leather option.
customer_reviews.author: G. VO

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for my hard to fit son!
customer_reviews.text: My slightly disabled son has always had good luck with this shoe, but has also had difficulty getting fitted in his extra wide size around the greater area of his town. I was delighted, not only to find his size on Amazon, but also to find such ready availability. He received the shoes within a day or two. Since his disability prevents him from driving, we are both very pleased that he can once again enjoy this particular shoe without having to use taxis or impose on friends, often without the results he's looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Collage707

customer_reviews.title: A good shoe with excellent support
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes for walking and tennis, here are the pros and cons: Pros: Solid and well built, leather and water-resistant, great support for cross-training, excellent tread on bottom (much better that those cheap strips other shoes have glued to the bottom), different widths offered Cons: A bit heavy, can be narrow so make sure to get the width you want (New balance has different widths in shoes), a little pricey
customer_reviews.author: Animal Friendly

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find a wide sneaker - these are great.
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes these sneakers so much that we keep ordering the exact same ones. He keeps two old ones in reserve, the oldest ones for messy jobs, the next for everyday wear, and the new pair he keeps for when he wants to wear nice, clean ones. He likes plain sneakers, no fancy colors or designs, and most importantly, he needs wide shoes. These fit the bill for him.
customer_reviews.author: BBS Fair Play

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made, almost no padding around ankle or in the tongue
customer_reviews.text: They do look pretty good, but the comfort and materials they're made from are terrible... Through the original (V1 which was great) up to this V5, these have gotten consistently worse and worse. Padding in the tongue is virtually gone now, so the laces dig into the top of your foot during most any activity, even just walking. The padding around the ankle opening is virtually gone too, allowing pressure points and your heal to slide up and down. The sole bottom is now flat with minimal tread features - looks like something you'd get at the dollar store. Congrats to the designers for finally getting the mfg costs under $1...
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Long time NB customer, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Been a long time NB customer so when I needed new shoes I didn't hesitate to look on-line since I'm familiar with the products. Bought these back in April and they fit good. I wear them every day. The last month or so one shoe has developed a hard bump inside the show right next to my small toe. As I continued to wear these I actually developed a sore on the toe and they started to hurt to wear them. Since the return period was long gone I put these in the closet and purchased another pair (difference style). Hoping these don't develop the same problem. I purchased these instead.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J. Quantz

customer_reviews.title: Order One Half Size Larger.
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear size 10.5D (medium) but had to return for 11's. They were too narrow in the toes area. When I was wearing the MX608V4's I wore 10.5. Also, Nike, Reebok, K-Swiss, Rockport as well, all 10.5 medium. But this MX608V5 shoe I recommend getting a half size larger. I think I have pretty normally shaped feet.
customer_reviews.author: draggedinbycat

customer_reviews.title: Very nice - I got a 1/2 size up
customer_reviews.text: I have the chocolate brown suede 608 V5. These are very nice in appearance and a good fit. I ordered a 1/2 size up and the toe box is about right. I see some comments that the toe box is a bit on the small size and would say there is some truth in that but with this type of shoe they stretch a lot with use and wonder if some people are comparing their old stretched shoes with the new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sam the sheepdog

customer_reviews.title: Poor Manufacturing Quality
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would write a Negative about New Balance.Like, is the fit. Fits like I expected a good pair of New Balance to do so. DisLike, No, HATE, is that only 5 months after getting these shoes, there is now a tear on the right shoe, only, inside section just above the N on the shoe, the entire length of the letter. There used to be a guarantee on these shoes, not sure if they are, but the tear makes me think about Cheap Chinese Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Predictable New Balence
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes to replace the last pair of NB 608 V4 that had worn out. I selected the series because of the expected fit due to the New Balance company's design of the shoe Last. From my experience, I've come to expect a particular fit, and the new V5 didn't disappoint. I felt comfortable with the first dressing. as they fit my feet as I wanted,... and expected. I'll continue with this predictable brand and design.
customer_reviews.author: W. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: No padding whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: My feet hurt within 10 minutes of standing in these shoes. There was no padding. I managed to survive the day and returned them the next. I had heard wonderful things about New Balance, but am looking at other brands now
customer_reviews.author: Susan Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Obnoxiously squeaky
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this model for years, and with each new pair, the shoes squeak more. The squeaking has gotten truly OBNOXIOUS. They are generous, comfortable, and come in 13EEEE, but the SQUEAK! Add to that the recent revelation of New Balance questionable political contributions, and I'm in the market for a new, good, walking shoe for a big guy--that doesn't squeak or support causes I want no part of.
customer_reviews.author: TimandEd

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFIC SHOE -- 5 STARS
customer_reviews.text: For the past 25 years I've stuck with New Balance; always happy with the shoe and they last. I saw this particular color - like dusty blue/grey and liked it right away. They arrived today. They look great;; great for the gym as well as going out to a casual restaurant; the shoe has a very nice clean and attractive look to it. Happy with the purchase. Jim
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought as school shoe for son. Would not recommend for working out. Stiff and being all leather, I can't imagine they would breath well. We have only had these for a few months and they are not holding up well. They fit well as my son has a flat/wide foot. He claims they feel fine but the look of them appear they would be a year old already. More disappointed with quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get good wear from this pair
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a series of New Balance shoes -- the 623, the 577, the 608v4, the 510. This is the second 608 I have purchased. Fit was great, comfort good. But it quickly fell victim to my biggest complaint about the shoes -- the extreme rear of the upper top wears and starts creating blisters at the back of my ankle. This pair lasted only 7 months. Now I do tend to walk 5 miles a day or more several times a week, but I have had other New Balance shoes last longer under the same treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 15 year very happy customer!🥰
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair of New Balance shoes. A pair will last a good 2 years with daily rough use, and 3 if you care for them properly (unlace before removing, use shoe horn as needed, buy correct size, clean and store correctly). They come in a variety of widths, from x narrow to xxxx wide. They are VERY comfortable, and have decent arch support without special inserts. Companies that sell special shoe inserts for diabetics have New Balance shoes in their catalogs, which is how I discovered them. They are well worth the money! I have never purchased poor quality shoes from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: These are not like the older 608v4 shoes. New Balance has changed how they manufacture these shoes. They are made cheaper like everything else we get from China. They are cut smaller then my older ones that still fit me but are a little ragged. I will buy these again. I like New Balance shoes, they do fit better me better then some of the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: NDRELOADER

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable - But quite ugly
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from shin splints so was looking for a pair of sneakers that could handle the impact of jump rope and jogging workouts. These sneakers 2 weeks in have certainly impressed, and the pain I usually endure has certainly wained. They were a half size too small (I found, so I did replace), and personally, they are little on the ugly side... But comfort wins the day, it's like having a memory foam pillow strapped to your feet.
customer_reviews.author: IceKoldKube

customer_reviews.title: My default shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing different versions of this shoe for years and find the quality consistent, the fit snug, the workmanship exceptional, the look great, the arch support as good as any in the business, and the price right. My only worry is that NB will stop making it.
customer_reviews.author: Up

customer_reviews.title: Calling all Dads
customer_reviews.text: The classic "Dad" shoe if there ever was one. These shoes are meant for 2 things, Grilling and when they've reached the end of their life, cutting the grass in. If you're over 40 and you need a fresh set of kicks to drop your teenage children off at college in, these are your only option.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Worst shoe company
customer_reviews.text: I've worn only New Balance sneakers for the last 16 years and have had each pair last me over a year. They obviously changed where they're made and the leather used for them. They have become garbage. This pair started ripping within the first month and in month 2 they each had multiple holes in them and the rubber at the front separated from the cheap leather. I'm really not sure it was actual leather. Do Yourself a favor and avoid New balance like the plague. I'm now wearing Skechers and they are great shoe. NB has turned into complete garbage and that's where mine ended up in only 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If the shoe fits, buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I always wear NB. I use primarily for my morning walks on the unpaved roads in my rural NM community. NB are a level of sturdy that is necessary to provide support and comfort in this situation. In addition, I can count on size consistency with NB and therefore its possible to buy online. Just a tip- Amazon provided a manf. coupon which reduced price markedly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had To Buy Half Size Bigger
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 pairs of 608v4's and this pair of 608v5's. My 1st v4's are 18 months old and black. I liked them and ordered a white pair JUST LIKE THEM. 10D size. They were too small! So I gave them to my wife and ordered a white pair of v5's in 10 1/2 D. They fit just right. I've been a huge NB sneaker fan for many years, but this put a real negative mark on the brand for me. FYI...yes, the black ones still fit fine, too.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, outstanding quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had numerous pairs of older models of this shoe and all were adequate. I was worried a new version might not live up to the quality I had come to expect. I was glad that these were quality shoes that were cut just a bit bigger than what I expected but still within a tolerance I could live with without having to return. The non-skid sole is a new feature and I can already appreciate that addition to the shoe. I say order with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Vehec

customer_reviews.title: Tried 2 New Balance — instep pain from design
customer_reviews.text: Two pairs of New Balance (NB) sneakers and both pairs have caused excessive pain on top of instep. Evidently, NB design is flawed! I do not have a high instep. The problem is that NB has stitching inside the sneaker without any protection for the sharp ridge caused by the stitching. This causes pain and irritation on my instep. Lately, I have heard similar complaints from other NB sneaker wearers. Maybe NB should check with Reebok as to how Reebok pads the stitching!
customer_reviews.author: Ray arpin

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing New Balance trainers for about 20 years now. They look good. Wear them anywhere an honest to goodness dress shoe isn't required - and you'll look sharp. They are trainers happy in the gym or jogging down the street, but you don't have to do any of that stuff. These shoes are comfortable footwear. Even if you're just shopping or just wandering around, you'll love them too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy !  Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 60-year-old cousin who is disabled and walks with a walker. they came in on February 1 , 2020 The sole is already coming apart from the shoe ,he hardly walks. He maybe does 500 -1000 steps a day. Can’t get a hold of customer service @ Amazon because of the coronavirus so I don’t know how I’m going to get my money back with Not being able to get a hold of a customer service representative
customer_reviews.author: Diane Mentzer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOE . . . . . . JUST WATCH THE SIZES!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for comfort and walking early in the morning. Be aware that the standard size is a medium width (D), even though that is stated nowhere. Watch it if you select W (wide); I was previously sent a size EE........waaaaay too wide. Can't imagine what Extra W would have gotten me???????????? Excellent shoe, however.
customer_reviews.author: TheUltimateMale

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look as good as depicted, are well made, and are very comfortable. I have worn various company's shoes; Adidas, Puma, K-Swiss, and Nike; but started buying New Balance due to difficulty in finding my size; 14 Wide; in the others. I have been very pleased with how New Balance fit and look. These have been great, and I may even purchase another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Walter E. Hersey, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: fitting, durability look. Sole adherance
customer_reviews.text: I like all,except the sole seperated.A little Shoe Glue works pretty well.New Balance refused all. Was only American made,except now I see "MADE IN CHINA.Big disappointment. Maybe now with Trump saying "BUY AMERICAN " Things may approve.This may be the only way to communicate with this heretofor great American Corporation.Sorry,I had to say it.
customer_reviews.author: DONALD E SHAY

customer_reviews.title: Bought se
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Question is if they will hold up 300+ miles without breaking down inner heal or some other part of shoe. Bought a second pair and first did hold up. They are just bang around shoes now and second pair for speed walking. Will buy a third pair and stash.away.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these from Amazon Warehouse so it was missing the original box, but wow what a great value. I have always been using New Balance shoes that are way over 3x the price, but these are just as comfortable. I was jogging and I think these are more comfortable than my expensive pair. Maybe not as good looking as the other pair, but Love it. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: K. Yagi

customer_reviews.title: Great, Like NBs Should Be
customer_reviews.text: NB had a decade of inferior shoes in gaudy colors, in my opinion, and maybe that's over with. This series of Trainers offers an understated design, good materials, and a retro leather feel with no cheap mesh stuff. I have a wide foot that's not easy to fit. But with these, I bought another pair after seeing how well the first pair fit. I hope NB keeps them in production.
customer_reviews.author: billyp

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: It shipped fast...Overall comfort of the shoe for me is a 4.5 out of 5...I bought a size 11 / X-Wide... the length was perfect but the width was just a touch small I normally wear a 2EE (New Balance) and sometimes a 3EE or 4EE depends on the shoe but if you are a true 4EE I DON'T think these shoes will work for you but if your a 2EE almost a 3EE then the shoe should fit GREAT! After 5 months or so these shoes have held up very good and I"m happy with them...CV
customer_reviews.author: Darby Vorce

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's 608v5 Casual Comfort Cross Trainer
product_meta.description: Move through your entire day as if it were a simple walk in the park with these New Balance 608v5 casual training shoes. These trainers boast impressive comfort features and a traditional running shoe silhouette you're sure to love. A durable leather upper sits atop a soft and supportive IMEVA midsole that provides lightweight cushioning, and an NB Comfort Insert made of plush polyurethane to deliver even more comfort. At the heel, an ABZORB crash pad helps absorb impacts through a combination of cushioning and compression resistance, helping to keep you comfortable even when your pace picks up. Around the ankles, dual-density collar foam helps prevent irritation and chafing. Firm yet surprisingly flexible, the rubber outsole of these training shoes features deep flex grooves that help the shoe move as your feet do, and an internal shank adds durability and more support underfoot. Whether you're looking for a cushioned shoe to wear for all-day comfort or a trendy addition to your sneaker collection, the 608v5 is your ideal option.
feature_bullets: Cushioning on Cushioning: The New Balance 608v5 is an incredibly comfortable training shoe that features cushioning from all angles – including an NB Comfort Insert for memory comfort that lasts
ABZORB Technology: These New Balance training shoes boast an ABZORB heel crash pad that absorbs impacts through a combination of cushioning and compression resistance
Dual-Density Collar Foam: Designed to help keep your feet feeling their greatest, these casual cross training shoes include dual-density collar foam that helps prevent irritation around your ankles
Flexible Outsole: These cushioned shoes feature impressive flexibility in the outsole thanks to deep flex grooves that cover the length of the sole to help you move through your day in comfort
Leather Upper: The 608v5 brings together the soft comfort you want with the premium leather upper you love. The lace-up closure, classic N logo and Flying NB at the tongue deliver true everyday style
